overview: From 2025-12-07 to 2025-12-14, ethereum-optimism/superchain-registry had 6 new PRs (6 merged), 0 new issues, and 42 active contributors.

topPRs.title: Celo-sepolia
topPRs.author: pahor167
topPRs.body:
<!--
This default template is a guide for PRs adding new chains to the registry.
For other types of PRs, please delete this template and write a brief description of your
code changes and rationale.
 -->

# Adding a New Chain

This PR adds [Chain Name Here] to the registry.

## Checklist

- [x] I have declared the chain at the appropriate [Superchain Level](../docs/glossary.md#superchain-level-and-rollup-stage).
- [ ] I have run `just codegen $SEPOLIA_RPC_URL,$MAINNET_RPC_URL` to ensure that all auto-generated files are updated
- [x] I have checked `Allow edits from maintainers` on this PR.

topPRs.title: chore: Celo Sepolia
topPRs.author: janjakubnanista
topPRs.body:
<!--
This default template is a guide for PRs adding new chains to the registry.
For other types of PRs, please delete this template and write a brief description of your
code changes and rationale.
 -->

# Adding a New Chain

This PR adds Celo Sepolia to the registry.

**It is currently stacked on top of #1115 and needs to be rebased once that one is in**

## Checklist

- [x] I have declared the chain at the appropriate [Superchain Level](../docs/glossary.md#superchain-level-and-rollup-stage).
- [ ] I have run `just codegen $SEPOLIA_RPC_URL,$MAINNET_RPC_URL` to ensure that all auto-generated files are updated
- [ ] I have checked `Allow edits from maintainers` on this PR.

Related to https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/platforms-team/issues/1134

topPRs.title: Add op-contracts/v5.0.0+l2-rev-share-contracts to standard versions
topPRs.author: maurelian
topPRs.body:
Adds a new tag op-contracts/v5.0.0+l2-rev-share-contracts to the standard versions toml files.

The addresses in the toml files are unchanged, but this is necessary for the op-deployer release process.

topPRs.title: Update Base Sepolia addresses
topPRs.author: cbfyi
topPRs.body:
Keeping addresses in sync.

Based on https://docs.base.org/docs/base-contracts/

Related to https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops/tree/main/tasks/sep/base-004-fp-audit-fixes and https://github.com/base-org/contract-deployments/pull/214

topPRs.title: Add 1.8.0 and 1.9.0-rc.1 prestates to standard-prestates.toml
topPRs.author: pauldowman
topPRs.body: This adds the finalized op-program 1.8.0 release, and the 1.9.0-rc.1 prestate to standard-prestates.toml

completedItems.title: updating gametype logic to support KONA
completedItems.body:
## Description

I've just updated the logic when generating the chainList.json to only mark chains as permissionless if they're using game type 1 (CANNON) or game type 8 (KONA-CANNON). 

## Additional information

We noticed that http

topContributors.summary: sbvegan: Drove a significant overhaul of the documentation, merging seven PRs focused on refactoring, content porting, and cleanup. This effort included a major refactor in `ethereum-optimism/docs#1909` that removed over 2,800 lines and a large content migration in `ethereum-optimism/docs#1911`. Their work, which also included preparing new feature documentation in `ethereum-optimism/docs#1914`, centered on improving the structure and content of the project's documentation.

maurelian: This week, maurelian focused on foundational contract work and provided extensive code review, conducting 37 reviews across the repositories. They merged a build improvement to enforce compiler warnings in `ethereum-optimism/optimism` (#18567) and opened a significant feature PR to add `SuperFaultDisputeGameV2` (#18565). Their code changes, totaling over 3800 new lines, were concentrated in tests and configuration files.

serpixel: Focused on deployment tooling and CI enhancements within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, merging six pull requests. They delivered significant impact by adding support for the `op-contracts/v5.0.0` upgrade to `op-deployer`, which included a large validation PR (#18586), and also introduced Docker and GitHub binary support (#18551). This work, primarily composed of bug fixes and feature development, was supported by their 10 code reviews.
almanax-ai: Focused on reviewing pull requests this week, contributing feedback via 43 review comments.

smartcontracts: Focused on enhancing contract validation and system configuration within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, merging three pull requests. Their most impactful contribution was the implementation of a new contract check runner in PR #18553 (+2088/-523 lines), alongside fixing a fuzz failure in a system config test via PR #18550. This work, supported by 17 code reviews, was primarily centered on bug fixes and new features, with changes concentrated in configuration and test files.

janjakubnanista: Focused on enhancing the stability of the deployment pipeline within `ethereum-optimism/optimism`, merging seven pull requests to address bugs and maintain consistency. They backported significant pipeline fixes to `op-deployer` v4 and v5 (#18538, #18539) and improved CLI error handling (#18532, #18591). This activity, concentrated on bugfixes within configuration and test files, demonstrates a strong commitment to the reliability of deployment tooling.

geoknee: This week, geoknee focused on improving the robustness and test coverage of the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, particularly within the `op-node`. They merged a pull request to add test coverage for future `SystemConfig` updates (#18566) and opened two new PRs to improve L1 origin selection and gracefully handle edge cases in recovery mode (#18589, #18556). In addition to their own code contributions, which were a mix of bug fixes and tests, they were highly engaged in the work of others, providing 20 code reviews.

Inphi: Focused on improving testing infrastructure and driving significant codebase cleanup within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository. They merged a PR to generate XML test results for CI (#18579), opened another to remove feature flags (#18588), and was highly engaged in collaboration with 16 code reviews. Their work involved substantial refactoring, reflected in over 7,100 lines of code removed, with a primary focus on feature and test-related work.

scharissis: Focused on improving the reliability and efficiency of the testing and CI infrastructure this week. They resolved a memory leak in the `op-acceptor`'s logging (infra#526) and implemented a key CI enhancement to add caching and retries (optimism#18572). This work was concentrated on bug fixes and configuration updates to bolster the development pipeline.

theochap: Focused on system maintenance and stability, opening several pull requests to upstream `op-rs/kona` (#18561, #18568, #18569). They also created an issue to address connection flakiness between op-reth and op-geth (#18570) and supported the team with 5 code reviews.

agusduha: Focused on resolving issues with missing commits in the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, merging a significant fix for missing CGT commits in PR #18560 (+405/-183 lines). In addition to opening two related PRs, they also contributed two approvals and three comments on other pull requests. This work showed a primary focus on test files, which constituted 81% of their code changes.

Wazabie: Focused on the Soneium testnet, merging a key pull request to enable permissionless functionality (#1317) and preparing future work with an open PR for betanet tasks (#1319). They also contributed through active collaboration, providing 6 reviews on other pull requests. Their work this week primarily involved modifications to tests, documentation, and configuration files.

teddyknox: Focused on expanding the project's testing infrastructure by merging a significant pull request in `ethereum-optimism/optimism` (#18540) to add `kona`, `rollup-boost`, and `op-rbuilder` as submodules for acceptance testing. This effort involved over 1,200 lines of new code and was supplemented by their active engagement in code review, where they provided 11 comments. Their work was primarily concentrated in test-related code and other foundational areas.

aliersh: Focused on improving the reliability of the testing and CI pipeline, landing two bug fixes in the ethereum-optimism/optimism repository. Their most significant contribution was a large fix to the AI contracts test suite to prevent race conditions by adding no-changes tracking (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18601), which involved over 700 lines of code changes. This work, combined with a fix to improve CI support for external pull requests (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18557), shows a clear focus on bug fixes and tests.

opgitgovernance: Focused on routine maintenance in the `ethereum-optimism/superchain-registry`, merging three automated codegen updates (#1177, #1178, #1180). They also actively engaged in code discussions, providing 11 comments on pull requests. Their work this week primarily involved modifications to configuration files.

0xDiscotech: Focused on preparing new production configurations, advancing a significant feature in `ethereum-optimism/superchain-ops` (#1318) which involved substantial changes (+13745/-3838 lines) across 446 files. Alongside this development, they contributed to code quality by conducting 4 reviews. Their work this week was primarily concentrated on tests and documentation, with a mix of feature and bugfix-related commits.

pauldowman: Focused on release coordination and system configuration, adding new prestates to the superchain registry in `ethereum-optimism/superchain-registry#1176`. He drove planning for upcoming releases and technical debt removal by creating several tracking issues, including `ethereum-optimism/optimism#17982` and `#18181`. Additionally, pauldowman proposed adding a timeout to the vm-runner in `ethereum-optimism/optimism#18594` and provided feedback across 5 reviews.

stevennevins: Focused on feature development and bugfixes, opening a pull request to add L2 chain ID lookup functionality in ethereum-optimism/optimism (#18559). They also actively supported the team by providing 8 code reviews and a PR comment. Their work involved substantial changes (+2379/-1117 lines) primarily centered on bugfixes, with an emphasis on configuration and test files.

0xiamflux: This week, 0xiamflux focused on a significant new feature, adding OPCM v2 support for chain upgrades to the op-deployer. This substantial effort is captured in a work-in-progress pull request (#18593) which introduces over 9,600 lines of code changes across 286 files. In support of this initiative, they also opened a related issue (#18536) and contributed 4 code reviews.

pcw109550 made a significant contribution to the Optimism node, merging a complex PR in `ethereum-optimism/optimism` (#18571) that ensures the consensus layer light client always follows its source. This single effort involved substantial changes (+1494/-1103 lines) across 115 files and took 100 hours to merge, indicating its complexity. Their work shows a primary focus on core logic, with a significant portion of the changes dedicated to tests.

devin-ai-integration: Focused on test configuration in the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, opening six pull requests to skip specific tests (e.g., #18600, #18595). While none of this work was merged, they also contributed 7 comments to pull requests.

AmadiMichael: Focused on verification work in the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, advancing the "verify opcm v2" pull request (#18590) with substantial changes across 88 files (+1138/-2404). Alongside this effort, they supported the team by reviewing 4 pull requests. Their contributions indicate a focus on bug fixes, with modifications primarily touching configuration and test files.
joshklop: Focused on providing feedback on pull requests this week, contributing 9 review comments and 1 additional PR comment across various changes.

axelKingsley: Focused on improving system specifications, merging a pull request in `ethereum-optimism/specs` (#868) to clarify how malformed system configuration updates are handled. They also identified an area for future improvement by opening an issue (`ethereum-optimism/optimism#18574`) to evaluate transaction replacement logic and supported the team by providing 3 code reviews. Their code contributions this week were concentrated in tests.

tremarkley: Focused on repository maintenance and team support this week, merging a fix to update CODEOWNERS in the `ethereum-optimism/infra` repository (infra#529). They also actively participated in code review, providing three approvals and one comment on other pull requests.

nonsense: Improved the reliability of the batcher acceptance tests by merging a fix to add a pending nonce busy wait (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18564). They also initiated a discussion to improve engineering operations by opening an issue to document the release process (#18592) and provided comments on two other pull requests.

antonkeen: This week's activity consisted of a maintenance update, merging a small change to the `circulatingSupply.txt` file in the `ethereum-optimism/ethereum-optimism.github.io` repository (PR #1246).
bitwiseguy: Focused on supporting the team this week by reviewing and approving 7 pull requests.

0xniha: Made significant progress on local changes, modifying 55 files with over 1400 lines of new code across 9 commits. While this work has not yet been opened for review, they supported the team by providing comments on 7 different reviews. Their coding efforts were split evenly between feature development and bug fixes.

Himess: Focused on code simplification within the batcher component this week, opening `ethereum-optimism/optimism#18534` to remove legacy logic related to the Pectra upgrade. This refactor modified 8 files with a net reduction in code (+41/-84), with changes split evenly between application and test files.

MSilb7: Focused on data integrity within the `op-analytics` repository, merging a pull request to "Fix Circ Supply" (ethereum-optimism/op-analytics#1773). This contribution consisted of a mix of bug fixing and refactoring, resulting in a notable change of +333/-331 lines.

0xmad: This week, 0xmad focused on preparing documentation for launching an OP Stack, opening a feature pull request in `ethereum-optimism/docs` (#1915). This work modified 7 files (+195/-68 lines), with changes concentrated in documentation and configuration files.

opsuperchain: Focused on bugfix work within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, opening a substantial pull request (#18603) to implement core filtering logic. This in-progress contribution is significant in scale, adding over 1400 lines of new code and tests across 30 files.

jsvisa: Focused on improving developer documentation, merging two feature PRs in `ethereum-optimism/docs`. Their most significant contribution involved splitting the JSON-RPC documentation (docs#1905), a substantial update adding over 780 lines, and they also updated the devnet docs to disable P2P by default (docs#1906). This work shows a primary focus on documentation and configuration files.
mds1: Focused on supporting the team through code review this week, providing 5 approvals on pull requests.
falcorocks: Focused on supporting the team through code review this week, providing 5 approvals on pull requests.

sebastianst: Focused on planning a major code migration, creating tracking issues (#18575, #18576, #18577) to move the `kona` and `op-reth` crates into the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` monorepo. Alongside this strategic planning, they remained engaged in code quality by providing five reviews and one comment on pull requests.

robert-e-davidson3: Focused on enhancing system resilience by proposing a new feature in `ethereum-optimism/optimism#18602` to implement a fallback to L1 if the AltDA service fails. This work involved a substantial implementation (+490/-4 lines) that included both new feature code and corresponding tests.

dRPCMarketing: Contributed a documentation update this week, merging a change to the dRPC entry in the `ethereum-optimism/docs` repository (PR #1908). This work reflects a primary focus on documentation.
ccerv1: Contributed to project documentation this week by updating the changelog in the ethereum-optimism/Retro-Funding repository (PR #90).
wiz-inc-a178a98b5d: Focused on collaboration this week, providing feedback across several pull requests through 4 reviews and 8 comments.
yashvardhan-kukreja: Focused on supporting the team through code review this week, providing feedback across 4 pull requests which included one approval.

tuxcanfly: Focused on the `op-batcher` within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository, opening a pull request (#18552) to make the number of frames per transaction configurable. This work represents their primary contribution for the week, consisting of a single commit across 6 files.

karlfloersch: Focused on bugfix work this week, authoring 6 commits with significant changes across 29 files (+835/-39 lines). In addition to this development, they also supported the team by reviewing 3 pull requests.
hexshire focused on test-related work, pushing commits that modified 6 files (+126/-38 lines). They also supported team collaboration by providing 3 review comments on pull requests.

op-will: Focused on design simplification this week, opening a pull request to propose a new design for the kona-node actor (ethereum-optimism/design-docs#358). This work involved adding 219 lines to a design document.

jurajpiar: Focused on initiating new work within the ethereum-optimism ecosystem this week. They opened two pull requests, `ethereum-optimism/op-geth#733` and `ethereum-optimism/optimism#18573`, which included changes across 76 files. This activity indicates a focus on foundational setup in the `op-geth` and `optimism` repositories.

googgoog: This week, googgoog focused on improving the efficiency of the op-proposer, opening a pull request in ethereum-optimism/optimism (#18587). The proposed change aims to avoid unnecessary `claimData` calls for non-matching game types. This contribution consisted of a targeted modification (+41/-4 lines) across both code and test files.

its-everdred: This week, its-everdred improved test coverage by adding a circulating supply test in `ethereum-optimism/ethereum-optimism.github.io` via PR #1247. They also contributed by reviewing and approving one pull request. Their work was entirely focused on tests.
kustrun: Focused on bug fixes within the `op-geth` repository this week, opening a pull request (ethereum-optimism/op-geth#732) to fix the `eth_simulateV1` endpoint following the Jovian fork.

operagxsasha: This week, operagxsasha focused on addressing a build process issue in the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository. They opened a pull request (#18541) to fix the FFI build by ensuring a full checkout. This work involved a minor change to a single configuration file.

Snezhkko: Focused on code maintenance within the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` repository this week. They opened a pull request (#18582) to remove an unused field in `op-conductor`, a minor cleanup involving the deletion of 6 lines of code.

mikhaildobs: This week's activity centered on a documentation contribution, opening a pull request (ethereum-optimism/docs#1917) to add a new faucet. This change consisted of a single-line addition to a test file.
findfluctuate: This week's activity was focused on documentation, where they opened a pull request in `ethereum-optimism/infra` (#531) to fix comments and improve readability.

Galoretka: Focused on bugfix work this week, opening a pull request to handle a missing hook in the node's critical error handler (ethereum-optimism/optimism#18535). This contribution represented their entire activity.
tynes: No activity this week.
raffaele-oplabs: No activity this week.
kmk142789: No activity this week.
JosepBove: No activity this week.
Joxess: No activity this week.

0xChin: Pushed 8 commits with significant code changes (+618/-308 lines) across 46 files this week, focusing on a mix of bug fixes, feature work, and tests. In addition to this development, they also provided feedback on a single pull request.

yaki-1337: Focused on issue tracking this week, opening an issue in `ethereum-optimism/optimism` (#18581) to report a node synchronization problem. They also contributed to discussions by commenting on two issues.
NIC619: This week, their focus was on the correctness of the `ethereum-optimism/optimism` codebase, where they identified and reported a potential bug concerning `OptimismPortal2` in issue #18554.
